person_analysis.overview: Parth Sareen is a Canadian engineer and entrepreneur based in Palo Alto, now a key contributor at Ollama. With a background in mechatronics from the University of Waterloo, he has built experience across Tesla, Autodesk, and health-tech before founding Extensible AI (Betaworks W’23). At Ollama, he is helping drive the adoption of open-source LLMs, structured outputs, and local AI workflows. A strong community builder, he organizes gpt-oss meetups and has volunteered at Hack the North and Socratica. His trajectory blends distributed systems engineering with a passion for democratizing AI through open-source tools.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Parth Sareen is a software engineer at Ollama and former founder of Extensible AI, with a strong foundation in distributed systems, LLM infrastructure, and startup ecosystems. A University of Waterloo graduate, he has held impactful roles at Tesla and Autodesk while building in the AI agent and open-source model ecosystem. With 7,600+ followers and leadership in community meetups, Parth combines technical depth in Go, Python, and AWS with public presence as a connector in the AI developer world.
key_insights: Currently at **Ollama**, driving gpt-oss and open-source AI integrations.
Past roles at **Tesla** and **Autodesk** in distributed systems.
Community leader: hosts **gpt-oss meetups** and hackathon workshops.
7.6k+ LinkedIn followers, strong credibility in AI/OSS developer community.
